abstract.para: This topic describes what &suseai; (&suseaia;) is, of which components it consists, and what the benefits of using &suseaia; are.

section.title: What is &suseaia;?
section.para: The &suseaia; service is a locally hosted generative AI. It provides secure auditable AI capabilities and allows organizations to deploy AI models on their own infrastructure using &slm;. The service ensures complete control over data and compliance with regulatory requirements.

section.title: How does &suseaia; work?
section.para: &suseaia; is designed to run on cluster nodes. Each cluster node consists of a foundation stack of services and a set of AI-related container images deployed from the Rancher Application Collection.

listitem.para: Rancher Prime ensuring container and application lifecycle management.
Statestack providing insight and debugging capabilities.

section.para: &suseaia; integrates RKE2 for &kube; runtime, Rancher Prime for container and application lifecycle management, NeuVector for security and compliance, StackState for insight, Open WebUI for the AI user interface, Ollama for serving models and governing RAG augmentation, and Milvus for scalable vector database support.

section.title: Benefits of using &suseaia;
section.para: Running the &suseaia; service brings the following benefits:

listitem.para: Non-local AI services raise concerns about data security and accessibility. Locally hosted AI, however, increases data privacy, security and compliance with regulatory standards.
&suseaia; provides a user-friendly interface for managing and deploying AI models.
Pre-built &nvidia; drivers and operator provide increased AI performance.
&suseaia; components are dynamically scalable, from the Web user interface to the underlying datastore.
&suseaia; cares about security—it uses TLS certificates for Web UI and API access. Data stored in a database are encrypted as well.
